decks.notes: This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with a constant stream of low-cost creatures and disruption spells. By consistently pressuring the opponent with early aggression and using cards like Hopeless Nightmare and Temporary Lockdown to disrupt their game plan, the deck aims to control the pace of the match and secure victory. In addition, the inclusion of powerful creatures like Loran of the Third Path and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse provide additional threats that can quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as fast as possible. By efficiently utilizing card draw and burn spells, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. With a mix of aggressive creatures and direct damage spells, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats and burst damage. The mana base is optimized for casting spells quickly and efficiently to maximize damage output.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to maintain board control and disrupt opponent's strategy through removal spells like Cut Down and Go for the Throat, as well as hand disruption with Duress. The deck includes powerful creatures like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Archfiend of the Dross to dominate the battlefield. Additionally, card advantage is gained through Mazemind Tome and Soulstone Sanctuary. The overall strategy is to out-value the opponent with efficient removal, hand disruption, and powerful creatures to win the game.

This UR Aggro deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost creatures and spells to pressure the opponent and deal damage early on. The deck includes cards like Burst Lightning and Stormchaser's Talent to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy, while creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Drake Hatcher provide consistent damage. The deck also includes spells like Spell Pierce and Stock Up to maintain tempo and protect your creatures. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive plays while maintaining some control over the game.

The main idea of the deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, dealing damage quickly and efficiently. By playing efficient creatures like Emberheart Challenger, Heartfire Hero, and Manifold Mouse, combined with burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike, the deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game before they can stabilize. The inclusion of cards like Monstrous Rage and Witchstalker Frenzy further enhances the deck's ability to deal large amounts of damage in a short amount of time.

The main idea behind this deck is to overwhelm your opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells in the early game. The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Emberheart Challenger and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using burn spells like Burst Lightning and Lightning Strike to control the board and deal direct damage to the opponent. With a mix of creatures with haste and burn spells, the deck aims to quickly bring the opponent's life total to zero before they can establish a strong defense. The mana base is built around Mountains and land cards that provide additional benefits for aggressive play.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Drake Hatcher, supported by pump spells like Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells like Burst Lightning. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive game plan with plenty of blue and red sources. The goal is to establish a fast clock and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly playing low-cost creatures and utilizing spells to deal damage to the opponent. It relies on the synergy between cheap creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with powerful instant spells like Burst Lightning and Stormchaser's Talent to push through damage and finish off the opponent quickly. The inclusion of cards like Slickshot Show-Off and Drake Hatcher provides additional value and board presence. The mana base is designed for consistency and the deck aims to be aggressive and proactive in controlling the board and winning the game.

This Dimir Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost, aggressive creatures like Floodpits Drowner and Spyglass Siren to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Cut Down and Go for the Throat help control the board and remove threats, while Enduring Curiosity and Preacher of the Schism provide card advantage. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Tishana's Tidebinder. With a mix of disruption and aggression, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and control the battlefield to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively attack the opponent with a mix of powerful creatures and spells that boost their strength. By utilizing cards like Break Out and Violent Urge, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently. The creatures in the deck, such as Tersa Lightshatter and Patchwork Beastie, are designed to deal damage fast and efficiently. The deck also includes cards like Wildfire Wickerfolk and Fear of Missing Out to maintain board control and pressure the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive playstyle of the deck.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The main goal is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain that pressure to quickly finish them off. The deck includes a mix of powerful creatures like Wildfire Wickerfolk and Patchwork Beastie, along with spells like Channeled Dragonfire and Monstrous Rage to help deal damage and control the board. With a combination of fast creatures and direct damage, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This aggressive mono black deck focuses on quickly taking control of the board with powerful creatures and removal spells. It utilizes cards like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to eliminate opposing threats while deploying strong creatures like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Duress and Intimidation Tactics to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By efficiently using its resources and maintaining board presence, this deck aims to overwhelm and defeat the opponent swiftly.

The deck focuses on playing aggressively and quickly with low-cost creatures and spells. It aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain it throughout. The key strategy involves playing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by direct damage spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage. The deck also includes card draw spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand to ensure a steady flow of resources. Overall, the deck aims to win the game by overwhelming the opponent with fast and consistent damage.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to apply pressure on the opponent. Combined with spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage, the goal is to deal damage efficiently and consistently. Drake Hatcher provides additional threats while Slickshot Show-Off offers removal options. Opt and Sleight of Hand help with card selection and maintaining tempo. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, relying on speed and efficiency to secure victory.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly deploy aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, while also utilizing spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to deal damage to the opponent. Opt and Sleight of Hand help to filter through the deck for more threats and answers. Slickshot Show-Off and Stormchaser's Talent provide additional sources of damage. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace and apply pressure on the opponent, using the UR color combination to combine aggression with spell support.

The main idea of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with quick and aggressive creatures, supported by a mix of burn spells and card draw. By efficiently using low-cost spells and creatures with abilities that trigger upon casting spells, the deck aims to maintain board presence and deal damage quickly to the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Burst Lightning allow for early pressure, while spells like Opt and Sleight of Hand help to ensure a consistent flow of resources and threats.

The key concept of this deck is to maintain control of the board through removal spells and disruptive creatures, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures to quickly finish off the opponent. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Go for the Throat and Duress, along with resilient creatures like Marang River Regent and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The goal is to efficiently deal with opposing threats while steadily building up a strong board presence to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

This deck focuses on maintaining aggression by playing low-cost creatures to deal damage quickly. It also includes cards that can control the opponent's board, such as removal spells and counters. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent while also disrupting their game plan. With a mix of creatures, removal spells, and control elements, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggression and disruption, ultimately leading to victory. The synergy between the creatures and spells in the deck allows for a versatile and powerful gameplay experience.

The deck focuses on aggressive play using a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Fear of Isolation and Hopeless Nightmare disrupt the opponent's strategy while Nurturing Pixie and Sunpearl Kirin provide early aggression. Utilizing a mix of removal spells like Go for the Throat and controlling spells like Spell Pierce, the deck aims to maintain board control. The inclusion of versatile cards like Grim Bauble and Stock Up help maintain card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to keep up pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and secure victories through aggressive plays.

The primary focus of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By playing powerful creatures like Marauding Mako and Tersa Lightshatter, alongside burn spells like Torch the Tower and Into the Flood Maw, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The deck also includes support spells like Spell Pierce and Sheltered by Ghosts to protect its threats and maintain board control. With a mix of creatures, burn, and control spells, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this deck is to create a fast-paced, aggressive strategy using powerful mono black creatures and removal spells to quickly take down the opponent. By utilizing cards like Duress and Go for the Throat to control the board, coupled with efficient creatures like Deep-Cavern Bat and Preacher of the Schism, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and deal damage quickly. With support from cards like Unholy Annex / Ritual Chamber and Soulstone Sanctuary, this deck can maintain its aggression and keep up the pressure on the opponent.

This mono black aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to utilize efficient removal like Go for the Throat and Cut Down to control the board while deploying threats like Archfiend of the Dross and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse to apply pressure. With a strong focus on tempo and disruption, this deck aims to seize the advantage early and maintain it throughout the game.

This deck focuses on assembling the pieces needed to play Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm combo, allowing you to cast multiple dragons for a powerful finish. The deck includes spells to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Marang River Regent provides an alternate win condition, while cards like Temporary Lockdown and Confounding Riddle help to control the board. Stock Up and Ephara's Dispersal provide card draw and versatility. Overall, this deck aims to quickly set up a powerful combo and overwhelm the opponent with a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the combination of Omniscience and Roiling Dragonstorm to create a powerful combo that can overwhelm opponents. The deck also focuses on controlling the board using cards like Temporary Lockdown and Moment of Truth while generating card advantage with cards like Stock Up and Meticulous Archive. The deck has a balanced mix of creatures, spells, and lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in executing the combo. By carefully managing resources and timing plays, this deck can quickly seize control of the game and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to set up a powerful combo using Omniscience to cast multiple spells for free and overwhelm the opponent. Cards like Marang River Regent and Moment of Truth are used to generate advantage, while spells like Spell Pierce and Temporary Lockdown provide control and protection. The deck includes a mix of card draw, ramp, and counterspells to ensure consistency in executing the combo. Overall, the goal is to create a board state where the player has an overwhelming advantage and can secure a victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures and spells to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. It utilizes cards like Glacial Dragonhunt and Burst Lightning to deal damage efficiently while also having card draw and mana fixing options. The goal is to build a board presence quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and burn spells. By playing a mix of creatures and instant/sorcery spells, this deck aims to be flexible and adaptable to different matchups.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and spells. By utilizing cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Stock Up to buff your creatures, as well as cards like Bushwhack and Torch the Tower to deal direct damage to your opponent, you can quickly end the game before your opponent has a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the inclusion of Enduring Vitality and Song of Totentanz allows you to protect your creatures and maintain your aggression throughout the game.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with low-cost creatures and burning spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Burst Lightning, the deck aims to control the board and pressure the opponent early on. Cards like Opt and Sleight of Hand help in ensuring card advantage and consistency in drawing necessary cards. The inclusion of spells like Monstrous Rage and Stormchaser's Talent further enhances the aggression of the deck, while cards like Spell Pierce provide a bit of control against opponent's spells.

The deck focuses on fast-paced aggression using low-cost creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by instant spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage. Opt and Sleight of Hand help to dig through the deck for key cards, while Stock Up and Stormchaser's Talent provide additional boosts to creatures. Riverpyre Verge, Shivan Reef, and Spirebluff Canal provide the necessary mana fixing for the deck to operate smoothly, allowing for a consistent and powerful UR Aggro strategy.

The central idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a combination of cheap, aggressive creatures and instant/sorcery spells that can deal damage or buff the creatures. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter to apply pressure early on, while also using spells like Burst Lightning and Monstrous Rage to control the board and push for the win. By efficiently using these resources and maintaining a steady flow of aggression, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly establish board presence and apply pressure early in the game. By utilizing cheap, aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Cori-Steel Cutter, along with efficient burn spells like Burst Lightning and Torch the Tower, the goal is to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. The deck also includes card draw and manipulation effects to ensure a steady stream of threats. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with a mix of lands that provide colored mana and utility.

The deck focuses on playing low-cost creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage quickly. It includes cards that can buff creatures' stats, increase their power, and control the opponent's board while maintaining card advantage. The mana base is designed to ensure a consistent flow of mana to play multiple spells each turn. The goal is to apply pressure early in the game and maintain aggression to secure victory before the opponent can stabilize.
